Sentencas: An energy-storage concept is proposed using molten Sb as the fuel in a reversible solid-oxide electrochemical cell (SOEC).
Titulo: Energy Storage in Electrochemical Cells with Molten Sb Electrodes

Sentencas: Because both Sb and Sb2O3 are liquids at typical SOEC operating temperatures, it is possible to flow Sb from an external tank and use it as the fuel under fuel-cell conditions and then electrolyze Sb2O3 during recharging.
Titulo: Energy Storage in Electrochemical Cells with Molten Sb Electrodes

Sentencas: This concept was tested using a button cell with a Sc-stabilized zirconia electrolyte at 973 K by measuring the impedances under fuel-cell and electrolyzer conditions for a range of stirred Sb-Sb2O3 compositions.
Titulo: Energy Storage in Electrochemical Cells with Molten Sb Electrodes

Sentencas: The Sb-Sb2O3 electrode impedances were found to be on the order of 0.15 Omega cm(2) for both fuel-cell and electrolyzer conditions, for compositions up to 30% Sb and 70% Sb2O3.
Titulo: Energy Storage in Electrochemical Cells with Molten Sb Electrodes

Sentencas: The open circuit voltages (OCV) were 0.75 V, independent of oxygen composition.
Titulo: Energy Storage in Electrochemical Cells with Molten Sb Electrodes

Sentencas: Some features of using molten Sb as an energy-storage medium are discussed.
Titulo: Energy Storage in Electrochemical Cells with Molten Sb Electrodes
